name: unpunctuality
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact of not arriving, doing something, or happening at the expected or correct time: She got a reputation for unpunctuality and skipping classes. As a manager, he was notorious for his intolerance of unpunctuality. Opposite

More examplesFewer examplesHe particularly abhorred unpunctuality among his students. The rail operator is a byword for inefficiency, unpunctuality, poor treatment of passengers, and overcrowding. She was well aware that she had a reputation for unpunctuality.His younger sister was always nagging him about unpunctuality for meals.
